title: P08-1105

sentences.text: Topical blog post retrieval is the task of ranking blog posts with respect to their relevance for a given topic .
To improve topical blog post retrieval we incorporate textual credibility indicators in the retrieval process .

We consider two groups of indicators : post level -LRB- determined using information about individual blog posts only -RRB- and blog level -LRB- determined using information from the underlying blogs -RRB- .
We describe how to estimate these indicators and how to integrate them into a retrieval approach based on language models .
Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set show that both groups of credibility indicators significantly improve retrieval effectiveness ; the best performance is achieved when combining them .

Entity-topical_blog_post_retrieval.label: Topical blog post retrieval
Entity-topical_blog_post_retrieval.description: The process or method of identifying and ranking online blog posts based on their relevance to a specific topic.

Entity-how_to_estimate_these_indicator.description: A methodology for calculating textual credibility indicators used in topical blog post retrieval, including both post-level and blog-level indicators.

Entity-two_group_of_indicator.description: Two distinct categories of credibility indicators, one based on individual blog posts (post-level) and another based on information about the underlying blogs (blog-level), used to improve topical blog post retrieval.

summary: Topical blog post retrieval is the task of ranking blog posts with respect to their relevance for a given topic . To improve topical blog post retrieval we incorporate textual credibility indicators in the retrieval process . We consider two groups of indicators : post level -LRB- determined using information about individual blog posts only -RRB- and blog level -LRB- determined using information from the underlying blogs -RRB- . We describe how to estimate these indicators and how to integrate them into a retrieval approach based on language models . Experiments on the TREC Blog track test set show that both groups of credibility indicators significantly improve retrieval effectiveness ; the best performance is achieved when combining them .

Predicate-ranking_with_respect_to_their_.label: ranking with respect to their relevance for a given
Predicate-ranking_with_respect_to_their_.description: This predicate establishes an ordering relationship between the subject and object based on how relevant each element of the subject set is to the specified context or category (the given). The ranking indicates which elements are most pertinent, useful, or applicable within that specific scope.

Predicate-improve.label: improve
Predicate-improve.description: The predicate 'improve' indicates a relationship where the subject takes action to enhance or augment the object. This can involve refining, optimizing, or enhancing the quality of the object.

Predicate-consider.label: consider
Predicate-consider.description: To consider means to think about or ponder something as a possibility or option. It implies evaluating or examining an idea, situation, or entity with careful thought and attention.

Predicate-estimate.label: estimate
Predicate-estimate.description: To estimate means to form an opinion or make a judgment about something's value, size, amount, or likelihood based on available information and reasoning. The predicate 'estimate' connects the subject (the entity performing the estimation) with the object (the thing being estimated), indicating that the subject is attempting to determine the magnitude or nature of the object through analysis, calculation, or other means.

Predicate-integrate_into.label: integrate into
Predicate-integrate_into.description: To integrate into means to combine or merge something (the subject) with another entity, concept, or framework (the object), resulting in a unified whole that incorporates and builds upon the original elements. This predicate suggests a process of assimilation, where the subject becomes an integral part of the larger structure or system represented by the object.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: To demonstrate or prove something through evidence or observation. The predicate 'show that' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, where the subject provides the means to establish or confirm the existence of the object.

Predicate-significantly_improve.label: significantly improve
Predicate-significantly_improve.description: To significantly improve means to cause a substantial and notable enhancement or advancement from what was previously possible or achievable. This predicate indicates that the subject has brought about a marked improvement, exceeding expectations or previous standards, resulting in a more effective or desirable outcome.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or category within a larger group or classification denoted by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and object, where the subject is a more specific or detailed concept than the object.
